citation.article-title: Arthrobacter equi sp. nov., isolated from veterinary clinical material
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Arthrobacter equi sp. nov.
Arthrobacter equi (e′qui. L. gen. n. equi of the horse).
Cells are Gram-positive-staining, non-motile, non-spore-forming and have a rod–coccus cycle.
Cells are aerobic, catalase-positive and oxidase-negative.

Colonies are cream-coloured, convex and smooth with entire margins, reaching 1–2 mm in diameter on Columbia blood agar supplemented with 5 % sheep blood, BHI agar, DST agar and TSA after 2 days of incubation at 34 °C.
No growth occurs at 37 °C.
Tolerates 0–2 % NaCl.
Grows at pH 6.0–9.0, with optimum growth at pH 6.0; does not grow at pH 4.0–5.0.
Nitrate reduction is negative.
Acetoin is not produced.

Hydrolyses adenine, casein, DNA (2 days of incubation), gelatin, hippurate, hypoxanthine, starch (3 days of incubation), tyrosine and urea, but not aesculin, elastin, guanine, keratin, testosterone or xanthine.

Acetate, l-arabinose, 2,3-butanediol, cellobiose, citrate, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-gluconate, p-hydroxybenzoate, myo-inositol, l-lactate, lactose, maltose, d-mannitol, melezitose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-sorbitol, sucrose, trehalose and d-xylose are utilized as carbon sources, but adipate, adonitol, iso-amylalcohol, meso-erythritol, m-hydroxybenzoate and 1,2-propanediol are not utilized as carbon sources.
l-Alanine, gelatin, l-proline and l-serine are utilized as simultaneous sources of carbon and nitrogen, but acetamide and ornithine are not utilized.
Acid is not produced from d-glucose, glycogen, lactose, d-mannitol, maltose, d-ribose, sucrose or d-xylose.
Activity is detected for β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, leucine arylamidase, pyrazinamidase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase.

No activity is detected for alkaline phosphatase, acid phosphatase, α-chymotrypsin, esterase C4, ester lipase C8, α-galactosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-fucosidase, lipase C14, α-mannosidase, cystine arylamidase, pyrrolidonyl arylamidase, valine arylamidase, trypsin and urease.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan type is A3α (Schleifer & Kandler, 1972) with an l-Lys–l-Ser–l-Thr–l-Ala interpeptide bridge.
The major menaquinone is MK-9(H2).
The polar lipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylinositol, two unknown phospholipids and two unknown glycolipids.
The major fatty acids are ai-C15 : 0 and i-C15 : 0.
The type strain is IMMIB L-1606T ( = DSM 23395T = CCUG 59597T), isolated from a genital swab of a horse.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 67.0 mol%.
